item.title: wtf uw 5: "student" employees
item.description: This is the fifth and final installment of my “Karl is so naive” series. I’ve only recently become aware of the big conflict between graduate student mentors' dual roles of advisor and employer. Now I see it everywhere. Should they take further courses? No just focus on research. Should they help out at a software workshop or take on a teaching assistant position or spend the summer doing an internship in industry?
